references.paper_title: Sound event localization and detection of overlapping sources using convolutional recurrent neural networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field, introducing the use of convolutional recurrent neural networks for sound event localization and detection, setting a baseline for subsequent research.

This review article provides a comprehensive overview of sound localization research, highlighting the Jeffress model and its extensions, which directly influenced the development of the proposed neuromorphic SSL framework.

references.paper_title: Axonal delay lines for time measurement in the owl's brainstem
references.reason: This pioneering work on the neural mechanisms of ITD processing in owls formed the biological basis for many subsequent models, including the one proposed in this paper.

references.paper_title: High-frequency oscillations in the output networks of the hippocampal-entorhinal axis of the freely behaving rat
references.reason: This study established the significance of high-frequency oscillations in neural networks, providing a biological foundation for the use of spiking neural networks in the proposed model.

references.paper_title: Spiking neuron models: Single neurons, populations, plasticity
references.reason: This book is a comprehensive resource on spiking neuron models, which provided crucial theoretical background on spike-based computations, enabling the development of the energy-efficient RF-PLC method.
